Subjective: Headache for ~2 months; worsening frequency, now almost weekly. Location: primarily right-sided, sometimes diffuse. Duration: lasts a few days. Associated with nausea (at worst), visual glare, photophobia, and phonophobia (prefers dark, quiet room). No vomiting or flashes of light. Tried paracetamol and ibuprofen with some relief. Impact: unable to play volleyball or socialize during episodes. Family Hx: father with migraines, grandfather with cluster headaches. No family hx of tumors. Social: 20yo student. No smoking, no drugs, occasional alcohol. Avoids coffee/energy drinks. Exercises regularly. Request: Wants diagnosis (migraine vs cluster headache?) and best treatment plan.
Objective: Vitals: BP 120/80, Pulse 50. Neuro exam: Cranial nerves intact. Finger-to-nose test good. Arm and leg strength good. Romberg's normal. Gait: slightly off but manageable.
Assessment: Suspected migraine. Cluster headache less likely.
Plan: 1. Education: Read about migraines on thuisarts.nl. 2. Medication: At symptom onset, take paracetamol (4x two tablets). May add ibuprofen if needed. 3. Monitoring: Keep a headache diary to identify patterns and triggers. 4. Follow-up: Return in 4 weeks with diary to evaluate. 5. Safety Netting: Return sooner if symptoms worsen significantly or change.
